com.thomsonreuters.upa.codec

Interface State


  • public interface State
    State conveys data and stream health information. When present in a message header, State applies to the state of the stream and data. When present in a data payload, the meaning of State should be defined by the DMM.
    See Also:
    DataStates, StreamStates, StateCodes

      • clear

        void clear()
        Clears State. Useful for object reuse.

      • isBlank

        boolean isBlank()
        Is State blank.

      • copy

        int copy(State destState)
        Perform a deep copy into destState
        Parameters:
        destState - the value getting populated with the values of the calling Object. If Copying destState.text, the user must provide a ByteBuffer large enough to the hold the contents of this.text *
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if the destState is null. CodecReturnCodes.BUFFER_TOO_SMALL if destination buffer is too small
        See Also:
        CopyMsgFlags

      • encode

        int encode(EncodeIterator iter)
        Used to encode State into a buffer.
        Parameters:
        iter - EncodeIterator with buffer to encode into. Iterator should also have appropriate version information set
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes
        See Also:
        EncodeIterator

      • decode

        int decode(DecodeIterator iter)
        Decode State.
        Parameters:
        iter - DecodeIterator with buffer to decode from and appropriate version information set
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS if success, CodecReturnCodes.INCOMPLETE_DATA if failure, CodecReturnCodes.BLANK_DATA if data is blank value.
        See Also:
        DecodeIterator

      • equals

        Checks if the two State values are equal.
        Parameters:
        thatState - the other State to compare to this one
        Returns:
        true if the two State values are equal, false otherwise

      • isFinal

        boolean isFinal()
        Is Final State.
        Returns:
        true if the state is a final state, false otherwise.

      • streamState

        int streamState(int streamState)
        An enumerated value providing information about the state of the stream, populated from StreamStates. Must be in the range of 0 - 31.
        Parameters:
        streamState - the streamState to set
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if streamState is invalid.

      • streamState

        int streamState()
        An enumerated value providing information about the state of the stream, populated from StreamStates.
        Returns:
        the streamState

      • dataState

        int dataState(int dataState)
        An enumerated value providing information about the state of data, populated from DataStates. Must be in the range of 0 - 7.
        Parameters:
        dataState - the dataState to set
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if dataState is invalid.

      • dataState

        int dataState()
        An enumerated value providing information about the state of data, populated from DataStates.
        Returns:
        the dataState

      • code

        int code(int code)
        An enumerated code providing additional state information. Typically indicates more specific information (e.g., pertaining to a condition occurring upstream causing current data and stream states). code is typically used for informational purposes. Populated from StateCodes. Must be in the range of StateCodes.NONE - 127.
        Parameters:
        code - the code to set
        Returns:
        CodecReturnCodes.SUCCESS on success, CodecReturnCodes.INVALID_ARGUMENT if code is invalid.

      • code

        int code()
        An enumerated code providing additional state information. Typically indicates more specific information (e.g., pertaining to a condition occurring upstream causing current data and stream states). code is typically used for informational purposes. Populated from StateCodes.
        Returns:
        the code
